MedicationStatement.name: MedicationStatement
MedicationStatement.description:
A record of a medication that is being consumed by a patient.   A MedicationStatement may indicate that the patient may be taking the medication now or has taken the medication in the past or will be taking the medication in the future.  The source of this information can be the patient, significant other (such as a family member or spouse), or a clinician.  A common scenario where this information is captured is during the history taking process during a patient visit or stay.   The medication information may come from sources such as the patient's memory, from a prescription bottle,  or from a list of medications the patient, clinician or other party maintains. 

The primary difference between a medication statement and a medication administration is that the medication administration has complete administration information and is based on actual administration information from the person who administered the medication.  A medication statement is often, if not always, less specific.  There is no required date/time when the medication was administered, in fact we only know that a source has reported the patient is taking this medication, where details such as time, quantity, or rate or even medication product may be incomplete or missing or less precise.  As stated earlier, the medication statement information may come from the patient's memory, from a prescription bottle or from a list of medications the patient, clinician or other party maintains.  Medication administration is more formal and is not missing detailed information.

dosage.short: Details of how medication is/was taken or should be taken

reasonReference.short: Condition or observation that supports why the medication is being/was taken

reasonCode.short: Reason for why the medication is being/was taken

subject.short: Who is/was taking  the medication

effectiveDateTime.short: The date/time or interval when the medication is/was/will be taken

effectivePeriod.short: The date/time or interval when the medication is/was/will be taken

effective.short: The date/time or interval when the medication is/was/will be taken

informationSource.short: Person or organization that provided the information about the taking of this medication

status.short: active | completed | entered-in-error | intended | stopped | on-hold | unknown | not-taken
status.isModifierReason: This element is labelled as a modifier because it is a status element that contains status entered-in-error which means that the resource should not be treated as valid

Provenance.name: Provenance
Provenance.description: Provenance of a resource is a record that describes entities and processes involved in producing and delivering or otherwise influencing that resource. Provenance provides a critical foundation for assessing authenticity, enabling trust, and allowing reproducibility. Provenance assertions are a form of contextual metadata and can themselves become important records with their own provenance. Provenance statement indicates clinical significance in terms of confidence in authenticity, reliability, and trustworthiness, integrity, and stage in lifecycle (e.g. Document Completion - has the artifact been legally authenticated), all of which may impact security, privacy, and trust policies.

observation-secondaryFinding.name: secondaryFinding
observation-secondaryFinding.description:
Secondary findings are genetic test results that provide information about variants in a gene unrelated to the primary purpose for the testing, most often discovered when [Whole Exome Sequencing (WES)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Exome_sequencing) or [Whole Genome Sequencing (WGS)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Whole_genome_sequencing) is performed. This extension should be used to denote when a genetic finding is being shared as a secondary finding, and ideally refer to a corresponding guideline or policy statement.

For more detail, please see:
https://ghr.nlm.nih.gov/primer/testing/secondaryfindings.

ClinicalImpression.name: ClinicalImpression
ClinicalImpression.description: A record of a clinical assessment performed to determine what problem(s) may affect the patient and before planning the treatments or management strategies that are best to manage a patient's condition. Assessments are often 1:1 with a clinical consultation / encounter,  but this varies greatly depending on the clinical workflow. This resource is called "ClinicalImpression" rather than "ClinicalAssessment" to avoid confusion with the recording of assessment tools such as Apgar score.

valueQuantity.short: Discrete value for grouping of ordinal or polychotomous variables

description.short: Description of content

description.short: Textual description of sample size for statistic

description.short: Textual description of the attribute estimate

type.short: The type of attribute estimate, eg confidence interval or p value

level.short: Level of confidence interval, eg 0.95 for 95% confidence interval

note.short: Footnote or explanatory note about the estimate

certainty.short: Certainty or quality of the evidence

subcomponent.short: A domain or subdomain of certainty

rating.short: Assessment or judgement of the aspect

variableDefinition.short: Evidence variable such as population, exposure, or outcome

observation-focusCode.name: focusCode
observation-focusCode.description: A code representing the  focus of an observation when the focus is not the patient of record.  In other words, the focus of the observation is different from `Observation.subject`.   An example use case would be using the *Observation* resource to capture whether the mother is trained to change her child's tracheostomy tube.  In this example, the child is the patient of record and the mother is focal subject referenced using this extension.  Other example focal subjects include spouses, related persons, feti, or  donors.

TestScript.name: TestScript
TestScript.description: A structured set of tests against a FHIR server or client implementation to determine compliance against the FHIR specification.

description.short: Natural language description of the test script

name.short: Name for this test script (computer friendly)

identifier.short: Additional identifier for the test script

title.short: Name for this test script (human friendly)

experimental.short: For testing purposes, not real usage

publisher.short: Name of the publisher (organization or individual)

version.short: Business version of the test script

origin.short: An abstract server representing a client or sender in a message exchange

index.short: The index of the abstract origin server starting at 1

status.isModifierReason: This is labeled as "Is Modifier" because applications should not use a retired {{title}} without due consideration

destination.short: An abstract server representing a destination or receiver in a message exchange

index.short: The index of the abstract destination server starting at 1

purpose.short: Why this test script is defined

action.short: A test operation or assert to perform

tst-2.human: Test action SHALL contain either an operation or assert but not both.

tst-6.expression: extension.exists() or (contentType.count() + expression.count() + headerField.count() + minimumId.count() + navigationLinks.count() + path.count() + requestMethod.count() + resource.count() + responseCode.count() + response.count() + validateProfileId.count() <=1)
tst-6.human: Only a single assertion SHALL be present within test action assert element.

tst-11.human: Test action assert SHALL contain either compareToSourceId and compareToSourceExpression, compareToSourceId and compareToSourcePath or neither.

tst-13.expression: (response.empty() and responseCode.empty() and direction = 'request') or direction.empty() or direction = 'response'
tst-13.human: Test action assert response and response and responseCode SHALL be empty when direction equals request

tst-8.expression: sourceId.exists() or (targetId.count() + url.count() + params.count() = 1) or (type.code in ('capabilities' | 'search' | 'transaction' | 'history'))
tst-8.human: Test operation SHALL contain either sourceId or targetId or params or url.

description.short: Tracking/reporting short description of the test

name.short: Tracking/logging name of this test

useContext.short: The context that the content is intended to support

tst-3.human: Variable can only contain one of expression, headerField or path.

expression.short: The FHIRPath expression against the fixture body

headerField.short: HTTP header field name for source

hint.short: Hint help text for default value to enter

name.short: Descriptive name for this variable

sourceId.short: Fixture Id of source expression or headerField within this variable

defaultValue.short: Default, hard-coded, or user-defined value for this variable

description.short: Natural language description of the variable

path.short: XPath or JSONPath against the fixture body

fixture.short: Fixture in the test script - by reference (uri)

autodelete.short: Whether or not to implicitly delete the fixture during teardown

autocreate.short: Whether or not to implicitly create the fixture during setup

setup.short: A series of required setup operations before tests are executed

action.short: A setup operation or assert to perform

tst-1.human: Setup action SHALL contain either an operation or assert but not both.

tst-7.expression: sourceId.exists() or (targetId.count() + url.count() + params.count() = 1) or (type.code in ('capabilities' |'search' | 'transaction' | 'history'))
tst-7.human: Setup operation SHALL contain either sourceId or targetId or params or url.

sourceId.short: Fixture Id of body for PUT and POST requests

encodeRequestUrl.short: Whether or not to send the request url in encoded format

type.short: The operation code type that will be executed

method.short: delete | get | options | patch | post | put | head

url.short: Request URL

targetId.short: Id of fixture used for extracting the [id],  [type], and [vid] for GET requests

accept.short: Mime type to accept in the payload of the response, with charset etc.

description.short: Tracking/reporting operation description

contentType.short: Mime type of the request payload contents, with charset etc.

requestHeader.short: Each operation can have one or more header elements

tst-10.human: Setup action assert SHALL contain either compareToSourceId and compareToSourceExpression, compareToSourceId and compareToSourcePath or neither.

requestMethod.short: delete | get | options | patch | post | put | head

contentType.short: Mime type to compare against the 'Content-Type' header

compareToSourceId.short: Id of the source fixture to be evaluated

minimumId.short: Fixture Id of minimum content resource

response.short: okay | created | noContent | notModified | bad | forbidden | notFound | methodNotAllowed | conflict | gone | preconditionFailed | unprocessable

compareToSourcePath.short: XPath or JSONPath expression to evaluate against the source fixture

period.short: The shelf life time period can be specified using a numerical value for the period of time and its unit of time measurement The unit of measurement shall be specified in accordance with ISO 11240 and the resulting terminology The symbol and the symbol identifier shall be used

type.short: This describes the shelf life, taking into account various scenarios such as shelf life of the packaged Medicinal Product itself, shelf life after transformation where necessary and shelf life after the first opening of a bottle, etc. The shelf life type shall be specified using an appropriate controlled vocabulary The controlled term and the controlled term identifier shall be specified

specialPrecautionsForStorage.short: Special precautions for storage, if any, can be specified using an appropriate controlled vocabulary. The controlled term and the controlled term identifier shall be specified

periodDuration.short: The shelf life time period can be specified using a numerical value for the period of time and its unit of time measurement The unit of measurement shall be specified in accordance with ISO 11240 and the resulting terminology The symbol and the symbol identifier shall be used

identifier.short: An identifier that is specific to this particular part of the packaging. Including possibly a Data Carrier Identifier

material.short: Material type of the package item

manufacturer.short: Manufacturer of this package Item (multiple means these are all possible manufacturers)

package.short: Allows containers (and parts of containers) within containers, still a single packaged product

type.short: A code expressing the type of characteristic

legalStatusOfSupply.short: The legal status of supply of the packaged item as classified by the regulator

jurisdiction.short: The place where the legal status of supply applies

code.short: The actual status of supply. In what situation this package type may be supplied for use

packageFor.short: The product that this is a pack for

identifier.short: A unique identifier for this package as whole

Composition.name: Composition
Composition.description: A set of healthcare-related information that is assembled together into a single logical package that provides a single coherent statement of meaning, establishes its own context and that has clinical attestation with regard to who is making the statement. A Composition defines the structure and narrative content necessary for a document. However, a Composition alone does not constitute a document. Rather, the Composition must be the first entry in a Bundle where Bundle.type=document, and any other resources referenced from Composition must be included as subsequent entries in the Bundle (for example Patient, Practitioner, Encounter, etc.).

observation-geneticsGene.name: Gene
observation-geneticsGene.description: The material on this page will be removed in a future release. This content is deprecated and SHOULD NOT be used. Implementers are instead directed to the ([Genomics Reporting Implementation Guide](http://hl7.org/fhir/uv/genomics-reporting/index.html)) for guidance. A region (or regions) that includes all of the sequence elements necessary to encode a functional transcript. A gene may include regulatory regions, transcribed regions and/or other functional sequence regions ([SO:0000704](http://www.sequenceontology.org/browser/current_svn/term/SO:0000704)). This element is the official gene symbol approved by the HGNC, which is a short abbreviated form of the gene name ([HGNC](http://www.genenames.org)). LOINC Code: ([48018-6](http://loinc.org/48018-6)).

clinicaldocument.name: Clinical Document
clinicaldocument.description:
The Clinical Document profile constrains Composition to specify a clinical document (matching CDA). 

The base Composition is a general resource for compositions or documents about any kind of subject that might be encountered in healthcare including such things as guidelines, medicines, etc. A clinical document is focused on documents related to the provision of care process, where the subject is a patient, a group of patients, or a closely related concept. A clinical document has additional requirements around confidentiality that do not apply in the same way to other kinds of documents.

SubstanceDefinition.name: SubstanceDefinition
SubstanceDefinition.description: The detailed description of a substance, typically at a level beyond what is used for prescribing.

manufacturer.short: The entity that creates, makes, produces or fabricates the substance

molecularWeight.short: The molecular weight or weight range

method.short: The method by which the weight was determined

amount.short: Used to capture quantitative values for a variety of elements

type.short: Type of molecular weight e.g. exact, average, weight average

status.short: Status of the code assignment, for example 'provisional', 'approved'

note.short: Any comment can be provided in this field

statusDate.short: The date at which the code status was changed

source.short: Supporting literature

classification.short: A categorization, high level e.g. polymer or nucleic acid, or food, chemical, biological, or lower e.g. polymer linear or branch chain, or type of impurity

name.short: Names applicable to this substance

status.short: The status of the name e.g. 'current', 'proposed'

source.short: Supporting literature

synonym.short: A synonym of this particular name, by which the substance is also known

translation.short: A translation for this name into another human language

preferred.short: If this is the preferred name for this substance

language.short: Human language that the name is written in

name.short: The actual name

jurisdiction.short: The jurisdiction where this name applies

official.short: Details of the official nature of this name

authority.short: Which authority uses this official name

status.short: The status of the official name, for example 'draft', 'active'

domain.short: The use context of this name e.g. as an active ingredient or as a food colour additive

description.short: Textual description of the substance

grade.short: The quality standard, established benchmark, to which substance complies (e.g. USP/NF, BP)

identifier.short: Identifier by which this substance is known

note.short: Textual comment about the substance's catalogue or registry record

role.short: Role that the moiety is playing

measurementType.short: The measurement type of the quantitative value

identifier.short: Identifier by which this moiety substance is known

molecularFormula.short: Molecular formula for this moiety (e.g. with the Hill system)

name.short: Textual name for this moiety substance

status.short: Status of substance within the catalogue e.g. active, retired

relationship.short: A link between this substance and another

isDefining.short: For example where an enzyme strongly bonds with a particular substance, this is a defining relationship for that enzyme, out of several possible relationships

amount.short: A numeric factor for the relationship, e.g. that a substance salt has some percentage of active substance in relation to some other

amountQuantity.short: A numeric factor for the relationship, e.g. that a substance salt has some percentage of active substance in relation to some other

comparator.short: An operator for the amount, for example "average", "approximately", "less than"

substanceDefinitionCodeableConcept.short: A pointer to another substance, as a resource or a representational code

substanceDefinitionReference.short: A pointer to another substance, as a resource or a representational code

amountRatio.short: A numeric factor for the relationship, e.g. that a substance salt has some percentage of active substance in relation to some other

amountString.short: A numeric factor for the relationship, e.g. that a substance salt has some percentage of active substance in relation to some other

ratioHighLimitAmount.short: For use when the numeric has an uncertain range

source.short: Supporting literature

substanceDefinition.short: A pointer to another substance, as a resource or a representational code

domain.short: If the substance applies to human or veterinary use

countryOfOrigin.short: The country or countries where the material is harvested

part.short: An anatomical origin of the source material within an organism

species.short: The species of an organism e.g. the Latin epithet of the species of the plant/animal

type.short: Classification of the origin of the raw material. e.g. cat hair is an Animal source type

genus.short: The genus of an organism e.g. the Latin epithet of the plant/animal scientific name

molecularFormulaByMoiety.short: Specified per moiety according to the Hill system

molecularWeight.short: The molecular weight or weight range

representation.short: A depiction of the structure or characterization of the substance

format.short: The format of the representation e.g. InChI, SMILES, MOLFILE (note: not the physical file format)

type.short: The kind of structural representation (e.g. full, partial)

document.short: An attachment with the structural representation e.g. a structure graphic or AnIML file

representation.short: The structural representation or characterization as a text string in a standard format

molecularFormula.short: Molecular formula (e.g. using the Hill system)

sourceDocument.short: Source of information for the structure

technique.short: The method used to find the structure e.g. X-ray, NMR

supplier.short: An entity that is the source for the substance. It may be different from the manufacturer

version.short: A business level version identifier of the substance

type.short: A code expressing the type of property
